recruiment and hiring.description: This entity covers various aspects of the job posting, including job title, employment type, salary, work location, and required qualifications for a Data Engineer position in Tokyo.

This entity covers the annual salary range (5,493,636 - 7,687,392 yen), breakdown of monthly salary components, overtime pay, various allowances (family, overtime, night shift, holiday work, commuting, relocation, business trip), and bi-annual bonuses.
This entity describes the work location in Shibuya, Tokyo, with potential for changes within company-designated areas, and mentions a non-smoking indoor policy.
This entity includes information about annual salary increases in May and opportunities for skill development through qualification support programs.
A 6-month trial period with no changes in conditions during this time.

Essential requirements include experience in database design and implementation, and data extraction using SQL. Preferred skills include experience with big data and data analysis infrastructure, and using IT for business improvement.
A team responsible for consolidating various company data into a BigQuery-based data infrastructure.
Building a data lake by integrating data from internal sales management systems, accounting systems, and various SaaS products.
Designing and constructing data warehouses and data marts using ETL tools to provide necessary data to each department.
Providing support for data visualization using BI tools and dashboards.
Proposing improvements for data input operations and supporting business improvements through data utilization.
Collecting data from internal systems and SaaS products, and building load processes for the data infrastructure using tools like Embulk, Digdag, and Airflow.
Preprocessing data and designing/implementing data models for data warehouses and marts using ETL tools like dbt.
Checking data quality and establishing operational rules for quality maintenance using tools like Great Expectations.
Using BI tools such as Looker and Tableau for data visualization support.
A data infrastructure tool used by the company's data analysis team to consolidate various internal data.
A tool used for data collection and loading processes.
A tool used for data collection and loading processes.
A tool used for data collection and loading processes.
An ETL tool used for data preprocessing and data model implementation.
A tool used for checking and maintaining data quality.
A BI tool used for data visualization support.
A BI tool used for data visualization support.
A key responsibility involving checking data quality and establishing operational rules for quality maintenance, using tools like Great Expectations.
A role that involves supporting data visualization using BI tools and dashboards, such as Looker and Tableau.
A position focused on proposing efficiency improvements for data input processes and supporting business improvements through data utilization.
A team responsible for centralized management of diverse company data, providing it in accessible formats for various departments.
The use of cloud technologies like BigQuery and various SaaS product APIs for data collection and processing.
An emphasis on close collaboration with different departments, including data provision and proposing data utilization improvements.
The initial phase after joining the company, involving understanding the current data infrastructure and providing data to various departments.
The hiring procedure including document screening, first interview with department and HR representatives, aptitude test, and final interview with executives.
A tool example mentioned for checking data quality and maintaining quality standards.
A BI tool example mentioned for data visualization support.
Another BI tool example mentioned for data visualization support.
A cloud technology mentioned as being used for data collection and processing.
Tools mentioned as being used in conjunction with BI tools for data analysis tasks.
A potential future responsibility for the hired individual, involving preparing data for analysis.
Another potential future responsibility for the hired individual, involving creating and implementing data structures.
The first step in the recruitment process, involving review of applicant documents.
The second step in the recruitment process, conducted by department and HR representatives.
The third step in the recruitment process, assessing the candidate's suitability for the role.
The last step in the recruitment process, conducted by executives.

holidays and leaves.description: This entity encompasses information about working hours (9:00-18:00), weekends off (Saturday and Sunday), public holidays, year-end holidays, summer holidays, paid leave (with over 93% utilization rate), and special leave for events like marriage (7 days).
Maternity leave before and after childbirth with a 100% return-to-work rate.
Timely shift system and monthly shift system allowing for flexible work hours.
A type of leave offered, though specific details are not provided.
Leave provided for nursing sick children.
Every Wednesday, employees can choose between office work and working from home.
5 days of paid leave per child for nursing care, separate from regular paid leave.
Additional leave option available to employees.

welfare insurance.description: This entity includes various welfare benefits such as health insurance, employment insurance, pension, worker's compensation insurance, casual dress code, family allowance, work-from-home options, flexible shifts, qualification support, childcare leave, babysitter subsidy, internal clubs, and social events.
A company-specific welfare program, though details are not provided.
Transportation costs covered up to 100,000 yen per month.
Annual salary increase occurs in May.
Bonuses are given twice a year, in June and December.
Comprehensive social insurance coverage including employment, workers' compensation, health, and pension insurance.
Monthly transportation allowance provided, with a maximum limit of 100,000 yen.
Employees are allowed to wear casual clothes to work.
Monthly allowance provided for children up to 18 years old, with varying amounts based on the number of children.
Every Wednesday, employees can choose between office work or working from home.
Timely Shift and Monthly Shift systems allow employees to adjust their work hours within a certain range.
A system allowing employees with children to choose work hours and evaluation styles that suit their needs.
Financial assistance provided for babysitting services.
Various social clubs within the company for activities like baseball, futsal, music, and Gunpla.
Events organized to promote interaction among employees.
Indoor smoking is prohibited to prevent passive smoking.
